content:
I share your view.

All I did was go to View > Threads and click Ignore Threads. Then switched the Thread column off by right-clicking it's icon and then going to the bottom of the list that pops up and choosing Apply Columns to... > Folder and its Children... > <account name> <account name>. See screenshot below as that should show it better than I can say it in words.

It would still be a pain if you've got lots of accounts to do.
creator: thepillenwerfer

content:
takimoto224, you can make a reply in your existing thread on this instead of creating a brand new thread as a reply.

To reply in a thread that is not locked, scroll down to Post a Reply box, type in your reply then click on Post Reply.

Your thread is https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1457973

content: click the menu in upper right and select addons&themes. In themes, see if the dark theme is enabled. If so, enable the light theme. That may be the issue.
creator: davidsk

content: One quick way is to highlight multiple messages in message list pane and then press delete key. Another way, in table view, is to click the icon at right of heading line and tick 'Select Messages' . This inserts a tickbox on each line in message list pane. tick the messages to delete and then press delete key.
creator: davidsk

creator: Ansamb

content:
If they can transfer your full account from one hosting server to another, your email should be accessible after the transfer as IMAP account, which is what I presume you are using. Only they can confirm that for you. For your personal backup, check in synchronization&storage that the folders are available for download and also verify that you have set sync all messages regardless of age. Then, click File>offline>download to ensure all messages are downloaded intact. Once you are sure that you have all messages. create local folders for each of the downloaded folders and copy to the local folders. That ensures the messages will not be deleted during any account activity during the move. This is a backup, so I encourage doing a backup of the profile for added safety.

If the web host staff move the mail successfully, you will not need this backup, but if they are unable to do it, you can enter manage the mail from local folder or upload to the new server. Doing that can be problematic, as IMAP isn't designed for high volume uploads. You could upload in small batches, or create a manual filter as that would slow the process slightly.
creator: davidsk

content: The best thing to do is to unsubscribe from allmail and the problem disappears. Allmail doubles your disc requirement and doubles your download time. it is a duplicate of every email so you lose nothing in unsubscribing.
creator: davidsk

See the All Mail section here: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Gmail

After unsubscribing, delete the All Mail and All Mail.msf files.

content: Appears to have been an issue with the "Check and Send" add-in. When I disabled it, emails sent fine.

content: You're being asked to enter your Windows user account password, which is separate from the TB primary password. The prompt can be disabled in Settings/Privacy Security, Passwords, 'Require device...', but you'll have to enter the Windows password to change the setting.
creator: sfhowes

content: That worked. Thank you. I didn't have a password. Put somehow I remembered the PIN
